level.text: The cost-plus-a-percentage-of-cost contract system of contracting shall not be used by the Agency.

No cost-reimbursement contract may be awarded under this title unless it is determined in writing that the contract is likely to be less costly to the Agency than any other type of contract, or that it is impracticable to obtain supplies or services of the kind or quality required except under this type. of contract.

All cost-reimbursement contracts shall contain a provision that only costs determined in writing to be reimbursable by the contracting officer, in accordance with cost principles set forth in §2027 of this chapter and Chapter 33 of Title 27 DCMR, shall be reimbursable.
Subject to the limitations of §§2017.1 and 2017.2 of this section, any type of contract which will promote the best interests of the Agency may be used.
The provisions of Chapter 24 of Title 27 DCMR shall apply to procurement by the Agency, except as provided in this section.
